Description: Necklace: composed of very many small disc beads of cornelian, many of silver, one of electrum and two cornelian long cylinders.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Mostagedda, Grave 544 Found at the neck of a woman
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: bangle (1929,1015.468), bracelet with amulet (1929,1015.469), girdles (1929,1015.470 & 1929,1015.471 & 1929,1015.472 & 1929,1015.473), necklace (1929,1015.475). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 101-2; pl. LXVII, tomb group (beads not drawn); Tomb register, pl.XLVIII; Bead register, pl. XLiXA.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (342)
